newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel - crude gives modest support.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel - crude gives modest support.

text.p: Thin demand was countered by thin supply of low sulphur straight run fuel oil on Friday.
Traders said there was limited interest, but thought there might be more buying next week once the market accepts crude's consolidation. Prices moved up to the low $140s fob NWE.

Russian high sulphur straight remained available. Three ice-strengthened 17,000 tonne fuel oil tankers have been chartered over the winter by a Russian fuel company. Shipbrokers expected these ships to boost fuel exports from Tallin and St Petersburg.
E-4s were pegegd around the mid to high $120s cif NWE.
